page.title: 12Ecology.Insects and birds.
page.content: On Wednesday 3rd July 1985, 25 pupils of Belford First School investigated the verges of the footpath leading West from the school beside the B6349 Belford to Wooler road. Amongst the insect life found in the wall were woodlice,7-spot ladybirds, click-beetles and flea-beetles.A large mass of mother-of-pearl moth caterpillars were found on the flowers of a stinging nettle.Common snails were found in the wall and undergrowth -all with right-handed shells.Many different types of spider were seen; one inside a pocket made by joining 2 leaves of a stinging nettle together with white threads. A skylark,chaffinch and wood-pigeon were heard singing nearby and in the distance,from the direction of Sionside,a cuckoo.
